text: Even good people are great at making bad decisions
author: NF

text: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

text: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
author: Dennis Ritchie

text: Sometimes it's better to leave something alone, to pause, and that's very true of programming.
author: Joyce Wheeler

text: In some ways, programming is like painting. You start with a blank canvas and certain basic raw materials. You use a combination of science, art, and craft to determine what to do with them.
author: Andrew Hunt

text: Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.
author: Burt Rutan

text: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

text: The most damaging phrase in the language is.. it's always been done this way
author: Grace Hopper

text: Don't write better error messages, write code that doesn't need them.
author: Jason C. McDonald

text: Me and pride made a pact.
author: NF

text: Maybe someday I can learn to be happy.
author: NF

text: My biggest failure in life is knowing that I never tried.
author: NF

text: A lot of people know me, but they don’t know me well.
author: NF

text: It’s hard to be clean when you play in the dirt.
author: NF

text: Make you cry makes me feel like a bad person.
author: NF

text: Just like you
author: NF

text: I want to know what it’s like to sit down with my friends and feel like they might understand me.
author: NF

text: I just need some time, I’m tryna think straight. I just need a moment in my own space. Ask me how I’m doin’, I’ll say “okay, ” yeah. But ain’t that what we all say?”
author: NF

text: It’s easy to blame God but harder to fix things.
author: NF

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma – which is living with the results of other people's thinking.
author: Steve Jobs

text: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more. If you look at what you don't have in life, you'll never have enough.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: If you set your goals ridiculously high and it's a failure, you will fail above everyone else's success.
author: James Cameron

text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
author: Anne Frank

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Nothing changes if nothing changes
In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Life is never fair, and perhaps it is a good thing for most of us that it is not.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: All great changes are preceded by chaos.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: Change alone is eternal, perpetual, immortal.
author: Arthur Shopenhauer

text: By changing nothing, nothing changes.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Change is inevitable. Growth is optional.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: Change your thinking, change your life.
author: Ernest Holmes

text: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
author: John Wooden

text: Nothing is forever except change.
author: Buddha
